COMMAND.name: show snmp
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To display the services information of SNMP, use the show snmp command in privileged EXEC mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to display the service information of SNMP (enable or disable).
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the show snmp command: Switch# show snmp SNMP services: disable

COMMAND.name: show snmp-server version
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To display the supported version of SNMP, use the show snmp-server version command in privileged EXEC mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to display snmp version information configured by command snmp-server version.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the show snmp-server version command: Switch# show snmp-server version SNMP version: SNMPv1/SNMPv2c/SNMPv3

COMMAND.name: show snmp-server community
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To display the SNMP community information, use the show snmp-server community command in privileged EXEC mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to display the community information configured by command snmp-server community.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: Switch# show snmp-server community Community-Access Community-String Security-name ------------------+--------------------+------------------- read-write centec comm1

COMMAND.name: show snmp-server engineID
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To display the identification of the local Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) engine and all remote engines that have been configured on the router, use the show snmp-server engineID command in EXEC mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: An SNMP engine is a copy of SNMP that can reside on a local or remote device.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example specifies 00000009020000000c025808 as the local engineID: Switch# show snmp-server engineID Engine ID : 00000009020000000c025808

COMMAND.name: show snmp-server sys-info
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To display the system information of SNMP, use the show snmp-server sys-info command in privileged EXEC mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The system contact can be set by using the snmp-server system-contact command. The system location can be set by using the snmp-server system-location command.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the show snmp-server sys-info command: Switch# show snmp-server sys-info Contact: admin@exampledomain.com Location: Sample Place

COMMAND.name: show snmp-server trap-receiver
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To display the SNMP traps receiver, use the show snmp-server trap-receiver command in privileged EXEC mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to display traps receiver information configured by command snmp-server trap target-address.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the show snmp-server trap-receiver command: Switch# show snmp-server trap-receiver Target-ipaddress mgmt-if udpport version pdu-type community -----------------+-------+--------+--------+---------+-------------------------------- 10.10.39.235 yes 162 v1 trap centec 10.10.39.235 yes 162 v2c trap centec

COMMAND.name: show snmp-server inform-receiver
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To display the SNMP informs receiver, use the show snmp-server inform-receiver command in privileged EXEC mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to display inform receiver information configured by command snmp-server inform target-address.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the show snmp-server inform-receiver command: Switch# show snmp-server inform-receiver Target-ipaddress mgmt-if udpport version pdu-type community -----------------+-------+--------+--------+---------+-------------------------------- 2.1.1.3 yes 162 v2c inform public

COMMAND.name: show snmp-server view

PARAM.name: view
PARAM.help: Specify a view name that want to show

COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "${view}" != "" ]; then cdbctl show/cdb/app/snmp_view/${view} else cdbctl show/cdb/app/snmp_view fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To display the family name, storage type, and status of a Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) configuration and associated MIB, use the show snmp-server view command in privileged EXEC mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to display the SNMP view configuration.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the show snmp-server view command: Switch# show snmp-server view View-name View-type Subtree -------------------------------+-----------------+--------- a1 included .1 a2 included .1.2 abc excluded .1.3.6.2 _all_ included .0 _all_ included .1 _all_ included .2 _none_ excluded .0 _none_ excluded .1 _none_ excluded .2

COMMAND.name: show snmp-server context

PARAM.name: ctextname
PARAM.help: Specify a context name that want to show

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To display the SNMP context information, use the show snmp-server context command in privileged EXEC mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to display the context information configured by command snmp-server context.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the show snmp-server context command: Switch# show snmp-server context Context-name ------------------------------- test contextA

COMMAND.name: show snmp-server usm-user

PARAM.name: username
PARAM.help: Specify a usm user name that want to show

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To display information about the configured characteristics of Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) users, use the show snmp-server usm-user command in privileged EXEC mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: An SNMP user must be part of an SNMP group, as configured using the snmp-server usm-user command.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the show snmp-server usm-user command: Switch# show snmp-server usm-user u3 User Name: u3 Auth Protocol: sha Auth password: abcdabcd Priv Protocol: des Priv password: 12341234 Storage Type: nonvolatile Row status: active

COMMAND.name: show snmp-server access

PARAM.name: accname
PARAM.help: Specify a access group name that want to show

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To display the access group information of SNMP, use the show snmp-server access command in privileged EXEC mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to display the access information configured by command snmp-server access.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the show snmp-server access command: Switch# show snmp-server access g1 Group name: g1 Context: test Security model: usm Security level: auth Context Match: exact Read view: _all_ Write view: none Notify view: none Storage Type: permanent Row status: active

COMMAND.name: show snmp-server group

PARAM.name: grpname
PARAM.help: Specify a group name that want to show

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To display the names of configured SNMP groups, the security model being used, the status of the different views, and the storage type of each group, use the show snmp-server group command in privileged EXEC mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: SNMP groups are configured using the snmp-server group command.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the show snmp-server group command: Switch# show snmp-server group g1 Group name: g1 Security model: v3 Security name: u1 Storage Type: permanent Row status: active Group name: g1 Security model: v3 Security name: u2 Storage Type: permanent Row status: active

COMMAND.name: show snmp-server notify

PARAM.name: notifyname
PARAM.help: Specify a notify name that want to show

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To display notification information of SNMP, use the show snmp-server notify command in privileged EXEC mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to display the notification information configured by command snmp-server notify.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the show snmp-server notify command: Switch# show snmp-server notify Notify-name Notify-type -------------------------------+--------------------------- note trap

COMMAND.name: show snmp-server target-address

PARAM.name: addname
PARAM.help: Specify a target address name that want to show

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To display target address information of SNMP, use the show snmp-server target-address command in privileged EXEC mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to display the target address information configured by command snmp-server target address.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the show snmp-server target-address command: Switch# show snmp-server target-address Targetaddress-name IP-address Mgmt-If Parameters -------------------------------+-----------------+-------+---------- tad1 10.10.27.232 yes p1

COMMAND.name: show snmp-server target-params

PARAM.name: paramsname
PARAM.help: Specify a target params name that want to show

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To display target params information of SNMP, use the show snmp-server target-params command in privileged EXEC mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to display the target params information configured by command snmp-server target params.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the show snmp-server target-params command: Switch# show snmp-server target-params p1 Target parameter name: p1 Message processing model: v3 Security model: v3 Security name: u1 Security level: noauth Storage Type: nonvolatile Row status: active

COMMAND.name: snmp-server enable
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To enable the SNMP function, use the snmp-server enable command in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The command is used to enable snmp global.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the snmp-server enable command: Switch(config)# snmp-server enable

COMMAND.name: no snmp-server enable
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To disable the SNMP function, use the no snmp-server enable command in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The command is used to disable snmp global.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the snmp-server disable command: Switch(config)# no snmp-server enable

COMMAND.name: snmp-server engineID

PARAM.name: eid
PARAM.help: Engine ID octet string of hexadecimal characters

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To specify the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) engine ID on the local device, use the snmp-server engineID command in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The SNMP engine ID is a unique string used to identify the device for administration purposes. You do not need to specify an engine ID for the device. For further details on the SNMP engine ID, see RFC 2571.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: An SNMP engine ID is generated automatically but is not displayed or stored in the running configuration. You can display the default or configured engine ID by using the show snmp-server engineID command.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the snmp-server engineID command: Switch(config)# snmp-server engineID 1234567890

COMMAND.name: no snmp-server engineID
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To remove the configured engine ID, use the no snmp-server engineID command.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The SNMP engine ID is a unique string used to identify the device for administration purposes. You do not need to specify an engine ID for the device. For further details on the SNMP engine ID, see RFC 2571.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: An SNMP engine ID is generated automatically but is not displayed or stored in the running configuration. You can display the default or configured engine ID by using the show snmp-server engineID command.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample remove from the snmp-server engineID command: Switch(config)# no snmp-server engineID 1234567890

COMMAND.name: snmp-server system-contact

PARAM.name: contact
PARAM.help: Specify SNMP system contact parameter

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To set the system contact (sysContact) string, use the snmp-server system-contact command in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to set the system contact of the SNMP agent so that these descriptions can be accessed through the configuration file.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: No system contact string is set
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is an example of a system contact string: Switch(config)# snmp-server system-contact admin@centecnetworks.com

COMMAND.name: no snmp-server system-contact
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To remove the system contact information, use the no snmp-server system-contact command.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to unset the system contact of the SNMP agent.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: No system contact string is set
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is an example of remove system contact string: Switch(config)# no snmp-server system-contact

COMMAND.name: snmp-server system-location

PARAM.name: location
PARAM.help: Specify SNMP system location parameter

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To set the system location string, use the snmp-server system-location command in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to set the system location of the SNMP agent so that these descriptions can be accessed through the configuration file.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: No system location string is set.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is an example of a system location string: Switch(config)# snmp-server system-location Sample Place

COMMAND.name: no snmp-server system-location
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To remove the location string, use the no snmp-server system-location command.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to remove the system location of the SNMP agent.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: No system location string is set.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is an example of remove system location string: Switch(config)# no snmp-server system-location

COMMAND.name: snmp-server version

PARAM.name: opt
PARAM.help: Select snmp version

PARAM.name: all
PARAM.help: Support all SNMP versions(default)

PARAM.name: v1
PARAM.help: Support SNMPv1

PARAM.name: v2c
PARAM.help: Support SNMPv2c

PARAM.name: v3
PARAM.help: Support SNMPv3

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To specify the support of SNMP version, use the snmp-server version command in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to set the SNMP version the switch supported.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: Support v1 v2c and v3 SNMP versions.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the snmp-server version command: Switch(config)# snmp-server version all

COMMAND.name: no snmp-server version
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To restore to the default value, use the no snmp-server version command.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to set the SNMP version the switch supported.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: Support v1 v2c and v3 SNMP versions.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the snmp-server version command: Switch(config)# no snmp-server version

COMMAND.name: snmp-server view

PARAM.name: vname
PARAM.help: Name of the view

PARAM.name: opt
PARAM.help: Include or exclude

PARAM.name: excluded
PARAM.help: View type: exclude a subtree

PARAM.name: included
PARAM.help: View type: include a subtree

PARAM.name: subtree
PARAM.help: Subtree name (.A.B.C.....)

PARAM.name: mask
PARAM.help: Define the subtree mask

PARAM.name: mval
PARAM.help: Subtree mask string in hexadecimal format

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To create or update a view entry, use the snmp-server view command in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Other SNMP commands require an SNMP view as an argument. You use this command to create a view to be used as arguments for other commands.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the snmp-server view command: Switch(config)# snmp-server view abc excluded 1.3.6.2

COMMAND.name: no snmp-server view

PARAM.name: vname
PARAM.help: Name of the view

PARAM.name: opt
PARAM.help: Include or exclude

PARAM.name: excluded
PARAM.help: View type: exclude a subtree

PARAM.name: included
PARAM.help: View type: include a subtree

PARAM.name: subtree
PARAM.help: Subtree name (.A.B.C.....)

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To remove the specified Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) server view entry, use the no snmp-server view command.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the snmp-server view command: Switch(config)# no snmp-server view abc excluded 1.3.6.2

COMMAND.name: snmp-server community
COMMAND.help: Set snmp community string and access

PARAM.name: cname
PARAM.help: Specify a SNMP community name

PARAM.name: opt
PARAM.help: Include or exclude

PARAM.name: read-only
PARAM.help: Read-only access with the community string

PARAM.name: read-write
PARAM.help: Read-Write access with the community string

PARAM.name: view
PARAM.help: Restrict this community to a named MIB view (default view is _all_)

PARAM.name: vval
PARAM.help: MIB view to which this community has access

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To set up the community access string to permit access to the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP), use the snmp-server community command in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The no snmp-server command disables all versions of SNMP.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: No SNMP community string is defined.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example shows how to set the read/write community string to centec: Switch(config)# snmp-server community centec read-write

COMMAND.name: no snmp-server community
COMMAND.help: Set snmp community string and access

PARAM.name: cname
PARAM.help: Specify a SNMP community name

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To remove the specified community string, use the no snmp-server community command.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: None
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: No SNMP community string is defined.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example shows how to remove the read/write community string centec: Switch(config)# no snmp-server community centec

COMMAND.name: snmp-server trap enable

PARAM.name: opt
PARAM.help: Select snmp version

PARAM.name: all
PARAM.help: Enable all traps

PARAM.name: coldstart
PARAM.help: Enable cold start trap, take effect after save configuration

PARAM.name: warmstart
PARAM.help: Enable warm start trap, take effect after save configuration

PARAM.name: linkdown
PARAM.help: Enable linkdown trap

PARAM.name: linkup
PARAM.help: Enable linkup trap

PARAM.name: system
PARAM.help: Enable system traps

PARAM.name: vrrp
PARAM.help: Enable vrrp traps

COMMAND.ACTION: #if test "${opt}" == "all"; then # cdbctl update/cdb/app/snmp_cfg/trap_enable_coldstart/1 # cdbctl update/cdb/app/snmp_cfg/trap_enable_warmstart/1 # cdbctl update/cdb/app/snmp_cfg/trap_enable_linkdown/1 # cdbctl update/cdb/app/snmp_cfg/trap_enable_linkup/1 # cdbctl update/cdb/app/snmp_cfg/trap_enable_system/1 # cdbctl update/cdb/app/snmp_cfg/trap_enable_vrrp/1 #else cdbctl update/cdb/app/snmp_cfg/trap_enable_${opt}/1 #fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To enable all Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) notification types that are available on your system, use the snmp-server trap enable command in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The snmp-server trap enable command is used in conjunction with the snmp-server trap target-address command. Use the snmp-server trap target-address command to specify which host or hosts receive SNMP notifications. To send notifications, you must configure at least one snmp-server trap target-address command.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: No notifications controlled by this command are sent.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the snmp-server trap enable command: Switch(config)# snmp-server trap enable all

COMMAND.name: no snmp-server trap enable

PARAM.name: opt
PARAM.help: Select snmp version

PARAM.name: all
PARAM.help: Enable all traps

PARAM.name: coldstart
PARAM.help: Enable cold start trap, take effect after save configuration

PARAM.name: warmstart
PARAM.help: Enable warm start trap, take effect after save configuration

PARAM.name: linkdown
PARAM.help: Enable linkdown trap

PARAM.name: linkup
PARAM.help: Enable linkup trap

PARAM.name: system
PARAM.help: Enable system traps

PARAM.name: vrrp
PARAM.help: Enable vrrp traps

COMMAND.ACTION: #if test "${opt}" == "all"; then # cdbctl update/cdb/app/snmp_cfg/trap_enable_coldstart/0 # cdbctl update/cdb/app/snmp_cfg/trap_enable_warmstart/0 # cdbctl update/cdb/app/snmp_cfg/trap_enable_linkdown/0 # cdbctl update/cdb/app/snmp_cfg/trap_enable_linkup/0 # cdbctl update/cdb/app/snmp_cfg/trap_enable_system/0 # cdbctl update/cdb/app/snmp_cfg/trap_enable_vrrp/0 #else cdbctl update/cdb/app/snmp_cfg/trap_enable_${opt}/0 #fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To disable all available SNMP notifications, use the no snmp-server trap enable command.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: None
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: No notifications controlled by this command are sent.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from unset the snmp-server trap enable command: Switch(config)# no snmp-server trap enable all

COMMAND.name: snmp-server trap target-address

PARAM.name: mgmt-if
PARAM.help: Use management namespace

PARAM.name: sub1
PARAM.help: Management port

PARAM.name: ipv4_addr
PARAM.help: Specify a SNMP IPV4 address

PARAM.name: source-ip
PARAM.help: bind source ip

PARAM.name: bind_addr
PARAM.help: Bind ip address

PARAM.name: ipv6_addr
PARAM.help: Specify a SNMP IPV6 address

PARAM.name: community
PARAM.help: Define the community string which has the access to receive trap

PARAM.name: cname
PARAM.help: Specify a SNMP community name

PARAM.name: udpport
PARAM.help: Define the remote port which to receive the trap

PARAM.name: port_id
PARAM.help: The port number which area is 0 to 65535, the default is 162

COMMAND.ACTION:
# get updport if [ -z "${port_id}" ]; then PORT=162 else PORT=${port_id} fi if test "${sub1}" == "ipv4_addr"; then if [ -n "${source-ip}" ]; then cdbctl create/cdb/sys/inband_snat/1#$PORT#${ipv4_addr}/type/5/ifname/${bind_if}/ip/${bind_addr}/ if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then exit 1 fi fi
if [ -n "${mgmt-if}" ]; then NS_BAND=outband cdbctl update/cdb/l3/check_mgmt_if_ip/${ipv4_addr} if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then exit 1 fi else NS_BAND=inband fi
cdbctl create/cdb/sys/ns_route/1#$PORT#${ipv4_addr}/5/$NS_BAND/ if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then cdbctl create/cdb/app/snmp_trap/${ipv4_addr}/${cname}/$PORT if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/app/snmp_trap/${ipv4_addr}/${cname}/$PORT/$NS_BAND/ else cdbctl delete/cdb/sys/ns_route/1#$PORT#${ipv4_addr}/$NS_BAND/ if [ -n "${source-ip}" ]; then cdbctl delete/cdb/sys/inband_snat/1#$PORT#${ipv4_addr} fi fi else if [ -n "${source-ip}" ]; then cdbctl delete/cdb/sys/inband_snat/1#$PORT#${ipv4_addr} fi fi else if [ -n "${mgmt-if}" ]; then NS_BAND=outband cdbctl update/cdb/l3/check_mgmt_if_ip/${ipv6_addr} if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then exit 1 fi else NS_BAND=inband fi cdbctl create/cdb/sys/ns_route/1#$PORT#${ipv6_addr}/5/$NS_BAND/ if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then cdbctl create/cdb/app/snmp_trap/${ipv6_addr}/${cname}/$PORT if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/app/snmp_trap/${ipv6_addr}/${cname}/$PORT/$NS_BAND/ else cdbctl delete/cdb/sys/ns_route/1#$PORT#${ipv6_addr}/$NS_BAND/ fi fi fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To configure a remote trap managerment IP address, use the snmp-server target-address command in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to specify the server target address to whitch the trap is sended.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The router does not send any trap messages.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the snmp-server trap target-address command: Switch(config)# snmp-server trap target-address mgmt-if 192.168.1.100 community test udpport 13

COMMAND.name: no snmp-server trap target-address

PARAM.name: mgmt-if
PARAM.help: Use management namespace

PARAM.name: sub1
PARAM.help: Management port

PARAM.name: ipv4_addr
PARAM.help: Specify a SNMP IPV4 address

PARAM.name: ipv6_addr
PARAM.help: Specify a SNMP IPV6 address

PARAM.name: community
PARAM.help: Define the community string which has the access to receive trap

PARAM.name: cname
PARAM.help: Specify a SNMP community name

PARAM.name: udpport
PARAM.help: Define the remote port which to receive the trap

PARAM.name: port_id
PARAM.help: The port number which area is 0 to 65535, the default is 162

COMMAND.ACTION:
# get updport if [ -z "${port_id}" ]; then PORT=162 else PORT=${port_id} fi
if [ -n "${mgmt-if}" ]; then NS_BAND=outband else NS_BAND=inband fi
if test "${sub1}" == "ipv4_addr"; then cdbctl delete/cdb/app/snmp_trap/${ipv4_addr}/${cname}/$PORT/$NS_BAND if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then cdbctl delete/cdb/sys/ns_route/1#$PORT#${ipv4_addr}/$NS_BAND/ cdbctl delete/cdb/sys/inband_snat/1#$PORT#${ipv4_addr} fi else cdbctl delete/cdb/app/snmp_trap/${ipv6_addr}/${cname}/$PORT/$NS_BAND if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then cdbctl delete/cdb/sys/ns_route/1#$PORT#${ipv6_addr}/$NS_BAND/ fi fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To remove the configuration of remote trap managerment IP address, use the no snmp-server trap target-address command.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: None
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The router does not send any trap messages.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from remove the snmp-server trap target-address command: Switch(config)# no snmp-server trap target-address mgmt-if 192.168.1.100 community test

COMMAND.name: snmp-server trap delay linkup

PARAM.name: trap_delay_time
PARAM.help: Linkup trap delay time (Unit:second; default is: no delay)

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To configure the trap delay linkup time, use the snmp-server trap delay linkup command in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to set the trap delay time for link up interface.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the snmp-server trap delay linkup command: Switch(config)# snmp-server trap delay linkup 10

COMMAND.name: snmp-server trap delay linkdown

PARAM.name: trap_delay_time
PARAM.help: Linkdown trap delay time (Unit:second; default is: no delay)

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To configure the trap delay linkdown time, use the snmp-server trap delay linkdown command in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to set the trap delay time for link down interface.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the snmp-server trap delay linkdown command: Switch(config)# snmp-server trap delay linkdown 10

COMMAND.name: no snmp-server trap delay linkup
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To configure the default trap delay linkup time, use the no snmp-server trap delay linkup command in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to set the default trap delay time for link up interface.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the no snmp-server trap delay linkup command: Switch(config)# no snmp-server trap delay linkup

COMMAND.name: no snmp-server trap delay linkdown
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To configure the default trap delay linkdown time, use the no snmp-server trap delay linkdown command in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to set default the trap delay time for link down interface.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the no snmp-server trap delay linkdown command: Switch(config)# no snmp-server trap delay linkdown

COMMAND.name: snmp-server inform target-address

PARAM.name: mgmt-if
PARAM.help: Use management namespace

PARAM.name: sub1
PARAM.help: Management port

PARAM.name: ipv4_addr
PARAM.help: Specify a SNMP IPV4 address

PARAM.name: source-ip
PARAM.help: bind source ip

PARAM.name: bind_addr
PARAM.help: Bind ip address

PARAM.name: ipv6_addr
PARAM.help: Specify a SNMP IPV6 address

PARAM.name: community
PARAM.help: Define the community string which has the access to receive trap

PARAM.name: cname
PARAM.help: Specify a SNMP community name

PARAM.name: udpport
PARAM.help: Define the remote port which to receive the trap

PARAM.name: port_id
PARAM.help: The port number which area is 0 to 65535, the default is 162

COMMAND.ACTION:
# get updport if [ -z "${port_id}" ]; then PORT=162 else PORT=${port_id} fi if test "${sub1}" == "ipv4_addr"; then if [ -n "${source-ip}" ]; then cdbctl create/cdb/sys/inband_snat/1#$PORT#${ipv4_addr}/type/5/ifname/${bind_if}/ip/${bind_addr}/ if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then exit 1 fi fi
if [ -n "${mgmt-if}" ]; then NS_BAND=outband cdbctl update/cdb/l3/check_mgmt_if_ip/${ipv4_addr} if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then exit 1 fi else NS_BAND=inband fi
cdbctl create/cdb/sys/ns_route/1#$PORT#${ipv4_addr}/5/$NS_BAND/ if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then cdbctl create/cdb/app/snmp_inform/${ipv4_addr}/${cname}/$PORT if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/app/snmp_inform/${ipv4_addr}/${cname}/$PORT/$NS_BAND/ else cdbctl delete/cdb/sys/ns_route/1#$PORT#${ipv4_addr}/$NS_BAND/ if [ -n "${source-ip}" ]; then cdbctl delete/cdb/sys/inband_snat/1#$PORT#${ipv4_addr} fi fi else if [ -n "${source-ip}" ]; then cdbctl delete/cdb/sys/inband_snat/1#$PORT#${ipv4_addr} fi fi else if [ -n "${mgmt-if}" ]; then NS_BAND=outband cdbctl update/cdb/l3/check_mgmt_if_ip/${ipv6_addr} if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then exit 1 fi else NS_BAND=inband fi cdbctl create/cdb/sys/ns_route/1#$PORT#${ipv6_addr}/5/$NS_BAND/ if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then cdbctl create/cdb/app/snmp_inform/${ipv6_addr}/${cname}/$PORT if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/app/snmp_inform/${ipv6_addr}/${cname}/$PORT/$NS_BAND/ else cdbctl delete/cdb/sys/ns_route/1#$PORT#${ipv6_addr}/$NS_BAND/ fi fi fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To specify the recipient of a Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) inform message, use the snmp-server inform target-address command in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to specify the server target address to which the inform is sended.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The router does not send any inform messages.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the snmp-server inform target-address command: Switch(config)# snmp-server inform target-address mgmt-if 192.168.1.100 community test udpport 100

COMMAND.name: no snmp-server inform target-address

PARAM.name: mgmt-if
PARAM.help: Use management namespace

PARAM.name: sub1
PARAM.help: Management port

PARAM.name: ipv4_addr
PARAM.help: Specify a SNMP IPV4 address

PARAM.name: ipv6_addr
PARAM.help: Specify a SNMP IPV6 address

PARAM.name: community
PARAM.help: Define the community string which has the access to receive trap

PARAM.name: cname
PARAM.help: Specify a SNMP community name

PARAM.name: udpport
PARAM.help: Define the remote port which to receive the trap

PARAM.name: port_id
PARAM.help: The port number which area is 0 to 65535, the default is 162

COMMAND.ACTION:
# get updport if [ -z "${port_id}" ]; then PORT=162 else PORT=${port_id} fi
if [ -n "${mgmt-if}" ]; then NS_BAND=outband else NS_BAND=inband fi
if test "${sub1}" == "ipv4_addr"; then cdbctl delete/cdb/app/snmp_inform/${ipv4_addr}/${cname}/$PORT/$NS_BAND if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then cdbctl delete/cdb/sys/ns_route/1#$PORT#${ipv4_addr}/$NS_BAND/ cdbctl delete/cdb/sys/inband_snat/1#$PORT#${ipv4_addr} fi else cdbctl delete/cdb/app/snmp_inform/${ipv6_addr}/${cname}/$PORT/$NS_BAND if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then cdbctl delete/cdb/sys/ns_route/1#$PORT#${ipv6_addr}/$NS_BAND/ fi fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To remove the specified host from the configuration, use the no snmp-server inform command.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: None
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The router does not send any inform messages.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from remove the snmp-server inform target-address command: Swtich(config)# no snmp-server inform target-address mgmt-if 192.168.1.100 community test

COMMAND.name: snmp-server context
COMMAND.help: Define a context name which need to create

PARAM.name: ctextname
PARAM.help: Specify the name of the context

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To create a Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) context, use the snmp-server context command in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: When set snmp-server access with context name, only context name be created then snmp server can access connect the device.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from add the snmp-server context command: Switch(config)# snmp-server context contextA

COMMAND.name: no snmp-server context
COMMAND.help: Define a context name which need to delete

PARAM.name: ctextname
PARAM.help: Specify the name of the context

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To delete an SNMP context, use the no snmp-server context command in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from remove the snmp-server context command: Switch(config)# no snmp-server context contextA

COMMAND.name: snmp-server usm-user

PARAM.name: remote

PARAM.name: eid
PARAM.help: Engine ID octet string of hexadecimal characters

PARAM.name: authentication

PARAM.name: sub1
PARAM.help: Select md5 or sha Authentication

PARAM.name: md5

PARAM.name: encrypt
PARAM.help: Specifies a hidden password will follow

PARAM.name: secret
PARAM.help: Specify the secret for enable password

PARAM.name: authpwd
PARAM.help: Specify an authentication password

PARAM.name: privacy

PARAM.name: sub2
PARAM.help: Select des or aes for privacy

PARAM.name: des
PARAM.help: Use DES for privacy

PARAM.name: encrypt
PARAM.help: Specifies a hidden password will follow

PARAM.name: secret
PARAM.help: Specify the secret for enable password

PARAM.name: pripwd
PARAM.help: Specify a privacy password

PARAM.name: aes
PARAM.help: Use AES for privacy

PARAM.name: encrypt
PARAM.help: Specifies a hidden password will follow

PARAM.name: secret
PARAM.help: Specify the secret for enable password

PARAM.name: pripwd
PARAM.help: Specify a privacy password

PARAM.name: sha
PARAM.help: Use SHA for authentication

PARAM.name: encrypt
PARAM.help: Specifies a hidden password will follow

PARAM.name: secret
PARAM.help: Specify the secret for enable password

PARAM.name: authpwd
PARAM.help: Specify an authentication password

PARAM.name: privacy
PARAM.help: Privacy parameters for the user

PARAM.name: sub2
PARAM.help: Select des or aes for privacy

PARAM.name: des
PARAM.help: Use DES for privacy

PARAM.name: encrypt
PARAM.help: Specifies a hidden password will follow

PARAM.name: secret
PARAM.help: Specify the secret for enable password

PARAM.name: pripwd
PARAM.help: Specify a privacy password

PARAM.name: aes
PARAM.help: Use AES for privacy

PARAM.name: encrypt
PARAM.help: Specifies a hidden password will follow

PARAM.name: secret
PARAM.help: Specify the secret for enable password

PARAM.name: pripwd
PARAM.help: Specify a privacy password

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To configure a new Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) usm user, use the snmp-server usm-user command in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: To configure a remote user, specify the IP address or port number for the remote SNMP agent of the device where the user resides.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from remove the snmp-server usm-user command: Switch(config)# snmp-server usm-user user1 authentication md5 mypassword privacy des yourpassword

COMMAND.name: no snmp-server usm-user
COMMAND.help: Define a user who can access the SNMPv3 engine

PARAM.name: usmname
PARAM.help: Specify a SNMP USM user name

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To remove a specified SNMP usm user, use the snmp-server usm-user command in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the snmp-server usm-user command: Switch(config)# no snmp-server usm-user user1

COMMAND.name: snmp-server group
COMMAND.help: Define a user security model group

PARAM.name: grpname
PARAM.help: Specify the name of the group

PARAM.name: user
PARAM.help: Define a user security name belongs to the group

PARAM.name: username
PARAM.help: Specify the name of the user

PARAM.name: security-model
PARAM.help: Define the group security model

PARAM.name: usm
PARAM.help: SNMPv3 usm model

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To configure a new Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) group, use the snmp-server group command in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to add a new SNMP server group in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: No SNMP server groups are configured.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the snmp-server group command: Switch(config)# snmp-server group g1 user user1 security-model usm

COMMAND.name: no snmp-server group
COMMAND.help: Define a user security model group

PARAM.name: grpname
PARAM.help: Specify the name of the group

PARAM.name: user
PARAM.help: Define a user security name belongs to the group

PARAM.name: username
PARAM.help: Specify the name of the user

PARAM.name: security-model
PARAM.help: Define the group security model

PARAM.name: usm
PARAM.help: SNMPv3 usm model

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To remove a specified SNMP group, use the no snmp-server group command.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: None
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: No SNMP server groups are configured.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from remove the snmp-server group command: Switch(config)# no snmp-server group g1 user user1 security-model usm

COMMAND.name: snmp-server access
COMMAND.help: Define the access for a exact group

PARAM.name: security-model
PARAM.help: Define the security model of the group

PARAM.name: usm
PARAM.help: Define the SNMPv3 usm security model

PARAM.name: sub1
PARAM.help: Select noauth or auth or priv

PARAM.name: read

PARAM.name: read_view
PARAM.help: Read MIB view name

PARAM.name: write

PARAM.name: write_view
PARAM.help: Write MIB view name

PARAM.name: notify

PARAM.name: notify_view
PARAM.help: Notify MIB view name

PARAM.name: context
PARAM.help: Set the access's context name

PARAM.name: context_name
PARAM.help: Specify a context name

PARAM.name: sub
PARAM.help: Select prefix or exact,default is exact

PARAM.name: prefix
PARAM.help: Context match(default is exact) type specification: prefix

PARAM.name: exact
PARAM.help: Context match(default is exact) type specification: exact

PARAM.name: auth
PARAM.help: Set security level to authentication but with no privacy

PARAM.name: read
PARAM.help: Restrict this access read area to a named MIB view

PARAM.name: read_view
PARAM.help: Read MIB view name

PARAM.name: write
PARAM.help: Restrict this access write area to a named MIB view

PARAM.name: write_view
PARAM.help: Write MIB view name

PARAM.name: notify
PARAM.help: Restrict this access notify area to a named MIB view

PARAM.name: notify_view

PARAM.name: context

PARAM.name: context_name
PARAM.help: Specify a context name

PARAM.name: sub
PARAM.help: Select prefix or exact,default is exact

PARAM.name: prefix
PARAM.help: Context match(default is exact) type specification: prefix

PARAM.name: exact
PARAM.help: Context match(default is exact) type specification: exact

PARAM.name: priv
PARAM.help: Set security level to authentication with privacy

PARAM.name: read
PARAM.help: Restrict this access read area to a named MIB view

PARAM.name: read_view
PARAM.help: Read MIB view name

PARAM.name: write
PARAM.help: Restrict this access write area to a named MIB view

PARAM.name: write_view
PARAM.help: Write MIB view name

PARAM.name: notify
PARAM.help: Restrict this access notify area to a named MIB view

PARAM.name: notify_view
PARAM.help: Notify MIB view name

PARAM.name: context
PARAM.help: Set the access's context name

PARAM.name: context_name
PARAM.help: Specify a context name

PARAM.name: sub
PARAM.help: Select prefix or exact,default is exact

PARAM.name: prefix
PARAM.help: Context match(default is exact) type specification: prefix

PARAM.name: exact
PARAM.help: Context match(default is exact) type specification: exact

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To set the access security of MIB view, use the snmp-server access command in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The command is used to create a access security for MIB view.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: No SNMP access group is defined
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the snmp-server access command: Switch(config)# snmp-server access manage security-model usm auth write _all_ read _all_

COMMAND.name: no snmp-server access
COMMAND.help: Define the access for a exact group

PARAM.name: accessname
PARAM.help: Specify the name of the group which has this access

PARAM.name: security-model
PARAM.help: Define the security model of the group

PARAM.name: usm
PARAM.help: Define the SNMPv3 usm security model

PARAM.name: sub1
PARAM.help: Select noauth or auth or priv

PARAM.name: noauth
PARAM.help: Set security level to no authentication

PARAM.name: context
PARAM.help: Set the access's context name

PARAM.name: context_name
PARAM.help: Specify a context name

PARAM.name: auth
PARAM.help: Set security level to authentication but with no privacy

PARAM.name: context
PARAM.help: Set the access's context name

PARAM.name: context_name
PARAM.help: Specify a context name

PARAM.name: priv
PARAM.help: Set security level to authentication with privacy

PARAM.name: context
PARAM.help: Set the access's context name

PARAM.name: context_name
PARAM.help: Specify a context name

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To remove the access security of MIB view, use the no snmp-server access command in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: None
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: No SNMP access group is defined
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from delete the snmp-server access command: Switch(config)# no snmp-server access manage security-model usm noauth

COMMAND.name: snmp-server notify
COMMAND.help: Define a notify name which related to send notification

PARAM.name: notifyname
PARAM.help: Specify the name of the notify

PARAM.name: tag
PARAM.help: Define a notify tag which help to find target address table

PARAM.name: tagname
PARAM.help: Specify the name of the tag

PARAM.name: sub
PARAM.help: Select trap or inform,default is trap

PARAM.name: trap
PARAM.help: Set notify type(default is trap) to TRAP

PARAM.name: inform
PARAM.help: Set notify type(default is trap) to INFORM

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To set the notification of traps for Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP), use the snmp-server notify command in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to send events with the notification type of error to the SNMP server.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: No SNMP notify names are configured
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the snmp-server notify command: Switch(config)# snmp-server notify note tag tt

COMMAND.name: no snmp-server notify
COMMAND.help: Define a notify name which related to send notification

PARAM.name: notifyname
PARAM.help: Specify the name of the notify

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To delete the notification of traps for Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP), use the no snmp-server notify command in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to delete the notification name of error to the SNMP server.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: No SNMP notify names are configured
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from delete the snmp-server notify command: Switch(config)# no snmp-server notify note

COMMAND.name: snmp-server target-address
COMMAND.help: Define a target address name which related to send notifications

PARAM.name: taraddname
PARAM.help: Specify the name of the target address

PARAM.name: param
PARAM.help: Define a param name which help to find target params table

PARAM.name: paraname
PARAM.help: Specify the name of the param

PARAM.name: mgmt-if
PARAM.help: Use management namespace

PARAM.name: sub1
PARAM.help: Management port

PARAM.name: ipv4_addr
PARAM.help: Define a remote notification receiver IPv4 address

PARAM.name: ipv6_addr
PARAM.help: Define a remote notification receiver IPv6 address

PARAM.name: udpport
PARAM.help: Define the remote port which to receive the notification

PARAM.name: port_id
PARAM.help: The port number which area is 0 to 65535, the default is 162

PARAM.name: timeout
PARAM.help: Define the timeout which detemine when to resend the notification

PARAM.name: timeout_val
PARAM.help: The timeout value which area is 0 to 65535, the default is 2 second

PARAM.name: retries
PARAM.help: Define the retry time when sends notification failed

PARAM.name: retries_val
PARAM.help: The retry time value which area is 0 to 255, the default is 3

PARAM.name: taglist
PARAM.help: Define taglist which related to notify table

PARAM.name: taglist_val
PARAM.help: The name of the taglist (128 tags are supported)

COMMAND.ACTION:
if [ -z "${port_id}" ]; then PORT=162 else PORT=${port_id} fi
if test "${sub1}" == "ipv4_addr"; then if [ -n "${mgmt-if}" ]; then NS_BAND=outband cdbctl update/cdb/l3/check_mgmt_if_ip/${ipv4_addr} if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then exit 1 fi else NS_BAND=inband fi
cdbctl create/cdb/sys/ns_route/1#$PORT#${ipv4_addr}/5/$NS_BAND/ if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then cdbctl create/cdb/app/snmp_target_addr/${taraddname}/param/${paraname}/mgmt_if/${mgmt-if}/ip_addr/${ipv4_addr}/udp_port/${port_id}/timeout/${timeout_val}/retries/${retries_val}/taglist/"${taglist_val}" if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then cdbctl delete/cdb/sys/ns_route/1#$PORT#${ipv4_addr}/$NS_BAND/ fi #else #cdbctl delete/cdb/sys/ns_route/1#$PORT#${ipv4_addr}/$NS_BAND/ fi else if [ -n "${mgmt-if}" ]; then NS_BAND=outband cdbctl update/cdb/l3/check_mgmt_if_ip/${ipv6_addr} if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then exit 1 fi else NS_BAND=inband fi
cdbctl create/cdb/sys/ns_route/1#$PORT#${ipv6_addr}/5/$NS_BAND/ if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then cdbctl create/cdb/app/snmp_target_addr/${taraddname}/param/${paraname}/mgmt_if/${mgmt-if}/ip_addr/${ipv6_addr}/udp_port/${port_id}/timeout/${timeout_val}/retries/${retries_val}/taglist/"${taglist_val}" if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then cdbctl delete/cdb/sys/ns_route/1#$PORT#${ipv6_addr}/$NS_BAND/ fi #else #cdbctl delete/cdb/sys/ns_route/1#$PORT#${ipv6_addr}/$NS_BAND/ fi fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To specify the recipient of a Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) notification message, use the snmp-server trap target-address command in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to configure a remote managers IP address. This command is used for SNMP v3.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the snmp-server target-address command: Switch(config)# snmp-server target-address targ1 param parm1 10.0.0.2 taglist tmptag1

COMMAND.name: no snmp-server target-address
COMMAND.help: Define a target address name which related to send notifications

PARAM.name: taraddname
PARAM.help: Specify the name of the target address

PARAM.name: mgmt-if
PARAM.help: Use management namespace

PARAM.name: sub1
PARAM.help: Management port

PARAM.name: ipv4_addr
PARAM.help: Define a remote notification receiver IPv4 address

PARAM.name: ipv6_addr
PARAM.help: Define a remote notification receiver IPv6 address

PARAM.name: udpport
PARAM.help: Define the remote port which to receive the notification

PARAM.name: port_id
PARAM.help: The port number which area is 0 to 65535, the default is 162

COMMAND.ACTION:
if [ -z "${port_id}" ]; then PORT=162 else PORT=${port_id} fi
if [ -n "${mgmt-if}" ]; then NS_BAND=outband else NS_BAND=inband fi
if test "${sub1}" == "ipv4_addr"; then cdbctl delete/cdb/app/snmp_target_addr/${taraddname}/mgmt_if/${mgmt-if}/ip_addr/${ipv4_addr}/udp_port/$PORT/ if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then cdbctl delete/cdb/sys/ns_route/1#$PORT#${ipv4_addr}/$NS_BAND/ fi else cdbctl delete/cdb/app/snmp_target_addr/${taraddname}/mgmt_if/${mgmt-if}/ip_addr/${ipv6_addr}/udp_port/$PORT/ if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then cdbctl delete/cdb/sys/ns_route/1#$PORT#${ipv6_addr}/$NS_BAND/ fi fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To remove the specified snmp-server trap target-address host from the configuration, use the no snmp-server target-address command.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used for SNMP v3 trap and inform.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from delete the snmp-server target-address command: Switch(config)# no snmp-server target-address targ1 10.0.0.2

COMMAND.name: snmp-server target-params
COMMAND.help: Define the target params name which related to send notifications

PARAM.name: paraname
PARAM.help: Specify the name of the target params

PARAM.name: user
PARAM.help: Define the user who has the access to send notifications

PARAM.name: username
PARAM.help: Specify the name of the user

PARAM.name: security-model
PARAM.help: Define notification security model

PARAM.name: sc_sub
PARAM.help: Select v3

PARAM.name: v3
PARAM.help: SNMPv3 security model

PARAM.name: message-processing
PARAM.help: Define message processing model

PARAM.name: msg_sub
PARAM.help: Select v3

PARAM.name: v3
PARAM.help: SNMPv3 message processing model

PARAM.name: sub
PARAM.help: Select noauth or auth or priv

PARAM.name: noauth
PARAM.help: Set security level to no authentication

PARAM.name: auth
PARAM.help: Set security level to authentication but with no privacy

PARAM.name: priv
PARAM.help: Set security level to authentication with privacy

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To specify the SNMP target information to be used in the generation of SNMP messages, use the snmp-server target-params in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The snmp-server target-params contains the SNMP target information to be used in the generation of SNMP messages.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output for the snmp-server target-params command: Switch(config)# snmp-server target-params param1 user usr1 security-model v3 message-processing v3 noauth

COMMAND.name: no snmp-server target-params
COMMAND.help: Define the target params name which related to send notifications

PARAM.name: paraname
PARAM.help: Specify the name of the target params

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To remove the specified snmp-server target information to be used in the generation of SNMP messages, use the no snmp-server target-params in global configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output form delete the snmp-server target-params command: Switch(config)# no snmp-server target-params param1
